description: Stricter childhood religious adherence relates to higher adult depression tendency scores.
population_or_subset: Adults >=18 with valid depression and religion responses
estimand: Average marginal effect from ordered logit
notes: Ordered logit executed via analysis/results.csv; release-ready effect reported with HC1 SEs and BH metadata.

description: Higher parental guidance ages 0-12 predicts better self-rated adult health.
estimand: Probability difference of very good/excellent health between top vs bottom quartile guidance
notes: Ordered logit executed (analysis/results.csv) with chronic illness monitoring noted in limitations.

description: Childhood emotional abuse associates with lower adult self-love scores.
estimand: Mean difference in self-love Likert score (linear regression)
notes: Linear regression executed (analysis/results.csv) with HC1 SEs; disclosure/robustness checks documented.

description: Liberal political orientation correlates with lower probability of current religious practice.
estimand: Risk difference from logit (religious practice yes/no)

description: Higher teen socioeconomic class predicts higher current net worth bracket.
estimand: Shift in ordered logit predicted probability of >$250k bracket
notes: Assess monotonic coding for classteen and networth

description: Childhood religiosity should not systematically predict sibling count, serving as a falsification check.
population_or_subset: Adults >=18 with complete religion and sibling information
estimand: Mean difference in sibling count per one-point shift in childhood religious importance
notes: Loop 051 falsification produced NC1 with targeted=N; results support the expectation that religiosity does not spuriously predict family size.
